name: Afflicted Deserter
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Afflicted Deserter.

editions.flavor: The rising of the first full moon eliminated any doubt as to the horrible truth lurking within.

name: Alpha Brawl
text: Target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to each other creature that player controls, then each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to that creature.

editions.flavor: Being an alpha means proving it every full moon.

name: Altar of the Lost
text:
Altar of the Lost enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast spells with flashback from a graveyard.

name: Archangel's Light
text: You gain 2 life for each card in your graveyard, then shuffle your graveyard into your library.

editions.flavor:
"This is the light of Avacyn. Even in her absence she offers us hope."
—Radulf, priest of Avacyn

name: Archdemon of Greed
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a Human. If you can't, tap Archdemon of Greed and it deals 9 damage to you.

editions.flavor: "The price is paid. The power is mine!"
"The price is paid. The power is mine!"

name: Artful Dodge
text:
Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
Flashback {U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: Those who know the alleys and sewers of the Erdwal can disappear like smoke.

name: Avacyn's Collar
Bar the Door
text: Creatures you control get +0/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"It may not look like much, but it's a good old door with strong wards. It'll hold."
—Olgard of the Skiltfolk

name: Beguiler of Wills
text: {T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of creatures you control.

editions.flavor: "Come, let me free you of the tyranny of thought."

name: Black Cat
text: When Black Cat dies, target opponent discards a card at random.

editions.flavor: Its last life is spent tormenting your dreams.
Its last life is spent tormenting your dreams.

name: Blood Feud
text: Target creature fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

editions.flavor: Succession is a matter of blood, and by blood it is often decided.

name: Bone to Ash
text:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"I can think of worse ways to go. On second thought, maybe not."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
"I can think of worse ways to go. On second thought, maybe not."—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Break of Day
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, those creatures gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)

name: Briarpack Alpha
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Briarpack Alpha enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The wolves turned on us and a chill swept over me. The pack had a new leader."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

"One of my greatest teachers."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Burden of Guilt
text:
Enchant creature
{1}: Tap enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
"Grab an axe and defend the gate! Your despair is an extravagance we can ill afford."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Burning Oil
text:
Burning Oil deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
Flashback {3}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: Every now and then, a devil's prank can give you a good idea.

name: Call to the Kindred
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top five cards of your library. If you do, you may put a creature card that shares a creature type with enchanted creature from among them onto the battlefield, then you put the rest of those cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Chalice of Death
text: {T}: Target player loses 5 life.

editions.flavor: The bitter taste of life's only certainty.

name: Chalice of Life
text: {T}: You gain 1 life. Then if you have at least 10 life more than your starting life total, transform Chalice of Life.

editions.flavor: The sweet taste of hope's promise.

name: Chant of the Skifsang
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -13/-0.

editions.flavor: The skifsang, seafarers of Nephalia, craft spells like other sailors craft nets—making them strong enough to snare even the deadliest catch.

name: Chill of Foreboding
text:
Each player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Flashback {7}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: "Wait . . . did you fellows hear something?"

name: Chosen of Markov
text: {T}, Tap an untapped Vampire you control: Transform Chosen of Markov.

editions.flavor: "I have been found worthy by this great house . . ."

name: Clinging Mists
text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, tap all attacking creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

name: Counterlash
text: Counter target spell. You may cast a nonland card in your hand that shares a card type with that spell without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: "Pathetic. Let me show you how it's done."

name: Crushing Vines
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target creature with flying.
• Destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor:
"Your veil's curse won't stop me, deathmage. I have taken down countless night hunters and this dark plane is not big enough for you to hide."
—Garruk Wildspeaker, to Liliana Vess

name: Curse of Bloodletting
text:
Enchant player
If a source would deal damage to enchanted player, it deals double that damage to that player instead.

editions.flavor: It is the demon's mark, an infernal claim on the flesh of the guilty.

name: Curse of Echoes
text:
Enchant player
Whenever enchanted player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player may copy that spell and may choose new targets for the copy he or she controls.

name: Curse of Exhaustion
text:
Enchant player
Enchanted player can't cast more than one spell each turn.

editions.flavor:
"I do believe your heresy will prove more difficult now that you have more pressing concerns."
—Bishop Argust

name: Curse of Misfortunes
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a Curse card that doesn't have the same name as a Curse attached to enchanted player, put it onto the battlefield attached to that player, then shuffle your library.

name: Curse of Thirst
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of Thirst deals damage to that player equal to the number of Curses attached to him or her.

editions.flavor:
"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."
—Odila, witch of Morkrut

"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."
—Odila, witch of Morkrut

name: Dawntreader Elk
text: {G}, Sacrifice Dawntreader Elk: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Silent as winter snow, it seeks wild places unspoiled by the walking dead.

name: Deadly Allure
text:
Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn and must be blocked this turn if able.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: What could be more irresistible than death?

name: Death's Caress
text: Destroy target creature. If that creature was a Human, you gain life equal to its toughness.

editions.flavor: The faint smell of cloves, the rustling of the wind, and a paralyzing descent into an airless, fathomless tomb.

name: Deranged Outcast
text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice a Human: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.

editions.flavor: Cast out by his village, he now takes grim offense at refugees who seek shelter in his forest.

name: Diregraf Captain
text:
Deathtouch
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever another Zombie you control dies, target opponent loses 1 life.

editions.flavor: Though its mind has long since rotted away, it wields a sword with deadly skill.

name: Divination
text: Draw two cards.

editions.flavor:
"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle
Even the House of Galan, who takes the most scholarly approach to the mystic traditions, has resorted to exploring more primitive methods in Avacyn's absence.
"Ask of Keranos that you may understand the stars that mark your destiny. Implore Erebos that you may accept the fate thus divulged."

"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle

"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle

"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle

—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle

name: Drogskol Captain
text:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +1/+1 and have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: Dead or alive, true leaders can inspire an entire army.

name: Drogskol Reaver
text:
Flying, double strike, lifelink
Whenever you gain life, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Wracked and warped with anguish, it obsessively seeks out other souls to hoard within its eternal prison.

name: Dungeon Geists
text:
Flying
When Dungeon Geists enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Dungeon Geists.

name: Elbrus, the Binding Blade

editions.flavor: Those who grasp its hilt soon hear the demon's call.

name: Elgaud Inquisitor
text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
When Elgaud Inquisitor dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "It will take more than steel alone to purge this world of evil."

name: Erdwal Ripper
text:
Haste
Whenever Erdwal Ripper deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: Savage vampires lurk in the Erdwal's network of passageways where prey is plentiful and easy to catch.

name: Evolving Wilds
text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.

"Our world is vast, but Thraben is its heart. The cathedral must stand even if the hinterlands are lost."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

text:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Faith's Shield
text:
Target permanent you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, instead you and each permanent you control gain protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

name: Falkenrath Aristocrat
text:
Flying, haste
Sacrifice a creature: Falkenrath Aristocrat gains indestructible until end of turn. If the sacrificed creature was a Human, put a +1/+1 counter on Falkenrath Aristocrat.

editions.flavor: "Your blood is quite pleasing. A pity there's not enough for both of us."

name: Falkenrath Torturer
text: Sacrifice a creature: Falkenrath Torturer gains flying until end of turn. If the sacrificed creature was a Human, put a +1/+1 counter on Falkenrath Torturer.

editions.flavor: "There was a time when our cages rang with wailing. Now only a handful of these whimpering fools remain."

name: Farbog Boneflinger
text: When Farbog Boneflinger enters the battlefield, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Here are some bones for you to choke on, dear brother!"
—Gisa, to Geralf

name: Favor of the Woods
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: Feeling abandoned by Avacyn, some Kessigers turned to the pagan rituals of their ancestors.

name: Feed the Pack
text: At the beginning of your end step, you may sacrifice a nontoken creature. If you do, put X 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.

name: Fiend of the Shadows
text:
Flying
Whenever Fiend of the Shadows deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles a card from his or her hand. You may play that card for as long as it remains exiled.
Sacrifice a Human: Regenerate Fiend of the Shadows.

name: Fires of Undeath
text:
Fires of Undeath deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {5}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: "I drink of those who are worthy of my palate. The rest I burn."

name: Flayer of the Hatebound
text:
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever Flayer of the Hatebound or another creature enters the battlefield from your graveyard, that creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

name: Fling
text:
As an additional cost to cast Fling, sacrifice a creature.
Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Masters of the sword know the blade is not the only weapon at their disposal.
Sometimes the cannoneer must become the cannonball.
It's raining rats and moggs.
It's raining rats and moggs.
About halfway to the target, Snukk vowed that he had been tricked for the last time.

Sometimes the cannoneer must become the cannonball.

name: Forge Devil
text: When Forge Devil enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to you.

editions.flavor: Devils infiltrated the lower levels of Thraben Cathedral, making cracks in load-bearing pillars and setting fire to precious archives.
A bit of pain never hurts.

name: Gather the Townsfolk
text:
Put two 1/1 white Human creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, put five of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.

editions.flavor: In the memories of those they lost lies the strength needed to defend their city.
In the memories of those they lost lies the strength needed to defend their city.

name: Gavony Ironwright
text: Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control get +1/+4.

editions.flavor: "I wish my work could shelter everyone, yet I pray we are never so few that it does."

name: Geralf's Messenger
text:
Geralf's Messenger enters the battlefield tapped.
When Geralf's Messenger enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Geralf's Mindcrusher
text:
When Geralf's Mindcrusher enters the battlefield, target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Ghastly Haunting
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: The body often twists and flails spasmodically as the spirit explores its new home.

name: Ghoultree
text: Ghoultree costs {1} less to cast for each creature card in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: It uproots entire fengrafs to add to its twisted frame.

name: Grafdigger's Cage
text:
Creature cards can't enter the battlefield from graveyards or libraries.
Players can't cast cards in graveyards or libraries.

editions.flavor:
"If you wind up in one of mine, you can be sure as silver it will be your last."
—Grafdigger Wulmer

name: Gravecrawler
text:
Gravecrawler can't block.
You may cast Gravecrawler from your graveyard as long as you control a Zombie.

editions.flavor:
"Innistrad's ghoulcallers are talented enough, but let me show you what someone with real power can create."
—Liliana Vess

"Innistrad's ghoulcallers are talented enough, but let me show you what someone with real power can create."
—Liliana Vess

name: Gravepurge
text:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"The Blessed Sleep? Ha! Wake up my lovelies, there's work to be done!"
—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony

"Lord Silumgar has given you a second chance to please him."
—Siara, the Dragon's Mouth

name: Gravetiller Wurm
text:
Trample
Morbid — Gravetiller Wurm enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.

editions.flavor: As the creatures of the night closed in on humanity, Innistrad's primeval forces stirred, as though waking to watch the slaughter.

name: Grim Backwoods
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}{B}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"I love what they've done with the place."
—Liliana Vess
"I love what they've done with the place."—Liliana Vess

—Liliana Vess

name: Grim Flowering
text: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."
—Halana of Ulvenwald

"Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."
—Halana of Ulvenwald

"Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."
—Halana of Ulvenwald

name: Griptide
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor:
"Beware the seagrafs just off the shore. These waters are filled with hungry geists looking for an easy meal."
—Captain Eberhart

"Beware the seagrafs just off the shore. These waters are filled with hungry geists looking for an easy meal."
—Captain Eberhart
When the sea god Thassa wishes to speak with a mortal, she does not issue a summons or grant a vision requesting a visit. The sea simply brings her guest before her.

name: Gruesome Discovery
text:
Target player discards two cards.
Morbid — If a creature died this turn, instead that player reveals his or her hand, you choose two cards from it, then that player discards those cards.

name: Harrowing Journey
text: Target player draws three cards and loses 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"There are always fools who attempt to traverse Kruin Pass before sundown and every time they wind up in a race for their lives."
—Old Rutstein

name: Haunted Fengraf
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Haunted Fengraf: Return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: A ghoulcaller's playground.
A ghoulcaller's playground.

name: Havengul Lich
text: {1}: You may cast target creature card in a graveyard this turn. When you cast that card this turn, Havengul Lich gains all activated abilities of that card until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Fusing intelligence with the power of undeath requires inspiration of the darkest kind.

name: Havengul Runebinder
text: {2}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield, then put a +1/+1 counter on each Zombie creature you control.

editions.flavor: "So many corpses, so little time."

name: Headless Skaab
text:
As an additional cost to cast Headless Skaab, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Headless Skaab enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: A head is a needless encumbrance when muscle is all that's required.

text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
As long as equipped creature is a Human, it gets an additional +1/+1.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Heckling Fiends
text: {2}{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.

editions.flavor: Their language may be a cacophonous agglomeration of chittering snorts and mad barking, but the message they send is all too clear.

name: Hellrider
text:
Haste
Whenever a creature you control attacks, Hellrider deals 1 damage to defending player.

name: Helvault
text:
{1}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.
{7}, {T}: Exile target creature you don't control.

name: Highborn Ghoul
text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

editions.flavor:
"All the dead sleep lightly here, no matter how refined their beds may be."
—Grafdigger Wulmer

name: Hinterland Hermit
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hinterland Hermit.

editions.flavor: He tried to live far from those he could hurt . . .

name: Hinterland Scourge
text:
Hinterland Scourge must be blocked if able.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Hinterland Scourge.

editions.flavor: . . . but the monster within was a tireless hunter.
In a world of monsters, it's the stuff of nightmares.

name: Hollowhenge Spirit
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Hollowhenge Spirit enters the battlefield, remove target attacking or blocking creature from combat.

text:

name: Lost in the Woods
text: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Forest card, remove that creature from combat. Then put the revealed card on the bottom of your library.

name: Loyal Cathar
text:
Vigilance
When Loyal Cathar dies, return it to the battlefield transformed under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
"I trust myself to do my duty, even unto death. It's what comes after that I'm afraid of."
—Constable Visil, to Thalia

name: Markov Blademaster
text:
Double strike
Whenever Markov Blademaster deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: "Mortals practice swordplay for a few decades at best. How can they ever attain the exquisite mastery that eternity has to offer?"
". . . and for that I shall be eternally grateful."

name: Markov Warlord
text:
Haste
When Markov Warlord enters the battlefield, up to two target creatures can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: "What use is a stake or holy symbol in the hands of a coward?"

name: Midnight Guard
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, untap Midnight Guard.

editions.flavor:
"When you're on watch, no noise is harmless and no shadow can be ignored."
—Olgard of the Skiltfolk

"When you're on watch, no noise is harmless and no shadow can be ignored."
—Olgard of the Skiltfolk

name: Mikaeus, the Unhallowed
text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Whenever a Human deals damage to you, destroy it.
Other non-Human creatures you control get +1/+1 and have undying. (When a creature with undying dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Mondronen Shaman
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mondronen Shaman.

editions.flavor: "Tovolar, my master. Gather the howlpack, for the Hunter's Moon is nigh and Thraben's walls grow weak."
"Tovolar, my master. Gather the howlpack, for the Hunter's Moon is nigh and Thraben's walls grow weak."

name: Moonveil Dragon
text:
Flying
{R}: Each creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:

text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

text:

Flying

Indestructible

Trample

At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ravager of the Fells.

name: Ravenous Demon
text: Sacrifice a Human: Transform Ravenous Demon. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: His twisted words entice the weak.
His twisted words entice the weak.

Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

Flying

editions.flavor: When angels despair, what hope can remain for mortals?
When angels despair, what hope can remain for mortals?

"The wolves of our valley are bred to detest the scent of ghouls. For centuries they have kept our estates clear of such carrion."
—Olivia Voldaren
Cats prowl the corridors of Avacyn's churches in search of devils or signs of their mischief.

name: Saving Grasp
text:
Return target creature you own to your hand.
Flashback {W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: Nothing's more valuable than perfect timing.

name: Scorch the Fields
text: Destroy target land. Scorch the Fields deals 1 damage to each Human creature.

editions.flavor:
"Your fields will turn as black as a ghoul's tongue and fire shall be your only harvest."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum

name: Scorned Villager
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Scorned Villager.

editions.flavor: "My village's fear drove me into the wild . . ."

editions.flavor: Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.

name: Séance
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, you may exile target creature card from your graveyard. If you do, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that card except it's a Spirit in addition to its other types. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Secrets of the Dead
text: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"The veil between the living and the dead is so very thin that the whispers of the ancients can finally be heard."
—Amalric of Midvast Hall

name: Shattered Perception
text:
Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.

editions.flavor:
"You must shatter the fetters of the past. Only then can you truly act."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

name: Shriekgeist
text:
Flying
Whenever Shriekgeist deals combat damage to a player, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Wounds of the flesh are easy to heal. Wounds of the mind may never be undone.

name: Sightless Ghoul
text:
Sightless Ghoul can't block.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: It blindly marches on Thraben's gates, guided by its master's direful will.

text: Flying, first strike

editions.flavor: It patrols the grafs for miles around Thraben, ensuring that the unhallowed do not wake for long.

text: {3}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Human: Destroy target creature.

name: Withengar Unbound
text:

Whenever a player loses the game, put thirteen +1/+1 counters on Withengar Unbound.

text:

"Steel in the heart, silver in the bow."
—Wolfhunter's creed

name: Wrack with Madness
text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.

name: Young Wolf
text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: The Ulvenwald makes no allowances for youth. Today's newborn is either tomorrow's hunter or tomorrow's lunch.

name: Zombie Apocalypse
